Help with ubuntu 8.04 doesnt recognize: take a look in your /var/log/messages.  Specifically, unplug the pen drive, type "tail -f /var/log/messages", plug pen drive in, wait a minute, and tell us what it said.
Attached SCSI removable disk
And then?  Does it say anything further?  Like "sdb1 sdb2 sdb3"
new high speed USB device using ehci_hcd and address 13
And nothing past that "address 13" thing?  Is the pen drive formatted?  or did it maybe get wiped?
Anything more come back?
sdb i think
Ok, time to get serious.  do "sudo fdisk  -l /dev/sdb "
Disk /dev/sdb: 8065 MB, 8065646592 bytes
OK... and nothing more?
Device Boot      Start         End      Blocks   Id  System  that's it
any details
does it list anything after the Device Boot line?
last time I used  was copy some files running ubuntu live, taking some file before format the pc
Well, it's not got any partitions on the pen drive now.  Something clobbered it.  Did you by any chance copy to /dev/sdb, not /dev/sdb1?
I did not
Well, is there anything on the pen drive you need?  Or can we wipe it?
Well, I don't know how to get that file off... as the partition table seems corrupted.  if you can copy it off on another system, I'd do that first.
how to wipe it?
you wipe it with fdisk or gparted.  But it will delete _all_ of the data that was once there.
